page.title: 02WISLEY/OCKHAM AIRFIELD
page.content: On the Wisley/Ockham border is the derelict airfield constructed in 1943 by Vickers Aviation(on land scheduled to be restored later to agriculture) as an addition to their Weybridge works. Hangars and workshops were removed in 1973, but failure to remove the runway and a recent application to turn the area into a terminal for light aircraft caused concern. Public opposition and a costly enquiry raised issued such as erosion of green belt, damage to natural beauty, pollution affecting plants at the RHS near-by, noise and traffic increase. As a result barriers now cross the runways and footpaths are restored, but the future of the land, now growing some crops again is still in doubt since, in spite of the M25 road link, it is being claimed for a Heathrow/Gatwick helicopter base.
